title: Graph of position vs time for a toy from force

content.description: A toy car of mass 6 kg, moving in a straight path, experiences a net force given by the function F = âˆ’3t. At time t = 0, the car has a velocity of 4 m/s in the positive direction and is located +8 m from the origin.
content.question: Which of the following best shows a graph of position d versus time t for the car?

choices.label: Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with d on the vertical axis and t on the horizontal axis. Choice A is a line that starts on the vertical axis above the origin and decreases linearly, intersecting the horizontal axis.

Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with d on the vertical axis and t on the horizontal axis. Choice B is a curve that starts on the vertical axis above the origin as a horizontal line, then becomes decreasing and concave down until reaching the horizontal axis where it becomes decreasing and concave up, and then finally ends as a horizontal line again.

Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with d on the vertical axis and t on the horizontal axis. Choice C is a curve that starts on the vertical axis above the origin decreasing and concave up, and has an asymptote with the horizontal axis.

Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with d on the vertical axis and t on the horizontal axis. Choice D is a curve that starts at the origin increasing and concave down, reaches a maximum, and then becomes decreasing and concave down, intersecting the horizontal axis.

Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with d on the vertical axis and t on the horizontal axis. Choice E is a curve that starts at a point on the vertical axis above the origin increasing and concave down, reaches a maximum, and then becomes decreasing and concave down, intersecting the horizontal axis.

content.answer: Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with d on the vertical axis and t on the horizontal axis. Choice E is a curve that starts at a point on the vertical axis above the origin increasing and concave down, reaches a maximum, and then becomes decreasing and concave down, intersecting the horizontal axis.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
